name: Amoud Foundation
mission: Founded in 1998, the Amoud Foundation impacts the local and global communities by helping people help themselves through sustainable humanitarian projects while maintaining trusting relationships. Amoud is an international humanitarian organization that today serves the people in the Horn of Africa. Amoud also does work on the home-front including helping with the 2006 Hurricane Relief and 2015 Garland Tornado recovery.
theoryOfChange: Amoud Foundation states it helps people help themselves through sustainable humanitarian projects while maintaining trusting relationships, and relieves suffering by establishing emergency relief and development programs.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.amoudfoundation.org/zakat (Source: https://www.amoudfoundation.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)

score_details.score_summary: AMOUD FOUNDATION shows exceptional impact and strong alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.amoudfoundation.org/zakat (Source: https://www.amoudfoundation.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: Amoud Foundation holds a Charity Navigator score of 88.5/100 and maintains a program expense ratio of 89.3%.
The foundation is zakat-eligible and provides options for donors to contribute to specific asnaf categories.
The organization reported total revenue of $9,535,194 and supports 15 orphan centers and 2 schools for the deaf/blind.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Amoud Foundation earns a high overall rating due to its exceptional financial efficiency and direct service impact, though its alignment score reflects a need for more comprehensive data reporting.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing data transparency to improve the medium data confidence rating.
Expanding public documentation of long-term impact metrics beyond financial outputs.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high donor fit for those seeking religious and cultural alignment, as it explicitly facilitates zakat-eligible donations for specific asnaf categories [2]. While it maintains a solid track record in humanitarian aid, the alignment score of 36/50 reflects a balance between its strong mission focus and the current level of available public data [1][2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates high impact through direct service delivery, maintaining a total revenue of $9,535,194 while keeping administrative costs low [1][5]. With a program expense ratio of 89.3% and a Charity Navigator score of 88.5/100, the organization shows strong financial health and accountability in managing its orphan and healthcare programs [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Amoud Foundation provides critical humanitarian aid and educational support to vulnerable children and families through a highly efficient financial model.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 89.3%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach beneficiaries.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised.
Strong liquidity with 12.7 months of working capital available.
baseline_narrative.summary: Amoud Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting 15 orphan centers and specialized schools for the deaf and blind [5]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill religious obligations through various humanitarian programs [2].

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to provide highly efficient, direct humanitarian and educational aid to vulnerable populations in Somalia while fulfilling their zakat obligations.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations with confidence
Prioritize organizations with exceptionally low overhead and high program ratios
Care deeply about orphan support and special education in the Horn of Africa
giving_considerations: Programs operate in regions with political instability and access challenges
Organization focuses heavily on direct service rather than systemic advocacy
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking hyperlocal US community impact or those who require rigorous academic evidence of long-term systemic change.

impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence helps ensure donations create real impact and long-term improvements in beneficiaries' lives.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Consistent revenue growth and high program efficiency indicate capacity to absorb and deploy additional funds effectively.

strengths.detail: The organization dedicates a <cite id="5">89.3% program expense ratio</cite> to its services, significantly outperforming the <cite id="1">89.8% peer median</cite>.
Amoud Foundation operates with remarkable cost-effectiveness, achieving <cite id="5">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite> in fundraising efficiency.
The charity has demonstrated sustainable expansion with an <cite id="5">18.6% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Amoud Foundation distinguishes itself through its highly efficient financial model and direct service delivery in the Horn of Africa. By maintaining a <cite id="5">89.3% program expense ratio</cite>, the organization ensures that nearly all contributions directly support its core mission of sustaining <cite id="5">15 orphan centers and 2 schools</cite>. This efficiency is further highlighted by its ability to raise funds at a cost of <cite id="5">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, maximizing donor impact. The organization's financial health is robust, supported by an <cite id="5">18.6% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite> and strong liquidity reserves, earning it an <cite id="1">88.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Amoud Foundation, founded in <cite id="5">1998</cite>, is a humanitarian organization dedicated to providing critical aid and educational support to vulnerable populations in <cite id="2">Somaliland and Somalia</cite>. The organization focuses its efforts on supporting <cite id="5">15 orphan centers and 2 schools</cite> for the deaf and blind. Operating with exceptional financial efficiency, the foundation reported <cite id="5">$9,535,194 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. It directs an outstanding <cite id="5">89.3% to program expenses</cite>, ensuring the vast majority of donor funds reach beneficiaries directly. Furthermore, the organization demonstrates remarkable cost-effectiveness with a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="5">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. The charity has experienced significant growth, maintaining an <cite id="5">18.6% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>. External evaluators recognize its performance, awarding it an <cite id="1">88.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. For Muslim donors, the organization is fully <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite>, serving categories including <cite id="2">fuqara, masakin, and fisabilillah</cite> through its direct service delivery model.
